pullRequest.body:
We formalize the axioms of Quillen's model categories.

---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

### PR summary [419359be85](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19158/commits/419359be850ef725410aadc6c40e2bc4d592c70d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.ModelCategory.CategoryWithCofibrations` (new file)|388|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.ModelCategory.Basic` (new file)|553|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ CategoryWithCofibrations`
`+ CategoryWithFibrations`
`+ CategoryWithWeakEquivalences`
`+ Cofibration`
`+ Fibration`
`+ ModelCategory`
`+ WeakEquivalence`
`+ cofibrations`
`+ fibrations`
`+ mem_cofibrations`
`+ mem_fibrations`
`+ mem_trivialCofibrations`
`+ mem_trivialFibrations`
`+ mem_weakEquivalences`
`+ trivialCofibrations`
`+ trivialCofibrations_sub_cofibrations`
`+ trivialCofibrations_sub_weakEquivalences`
`+ trivialFibrations`
`+ trivialFibrations_sub_fibrations`
`+ trivialFibrations_sub_weakEquivalences`
`+ weakEquivalences`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
What is the plan for categories with more than one canonical model structure? Have wrappers with the respective instances?

> What is the plan for categories with more than one canonical model structure? Have wrappers with the respective instances?



> What is the plan for categories with more than one canonical model structure? Have wrappers with the respective instances?

The more practical solution seems to put instances on type-synonyms.
Yes, that's what I meant by wrapper :upside_down_face:

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12724723103/job/35471183352)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12724723103/job/35471183436)

```suggestion
`CategoryWithWeakEquivalences` to express that a category `C` is equipped with
```

```suggestion
to define only local instances of `ModelCategory`, or to set these instances on type synonyms.
```
What's the reasoning for choosing cofibrations in the file name?
I could have used `CategoryWithFibrations`, but this could create a confusion with the established notion of "category of fibrant objects" in the literature.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicTopology): model categories
